body_html:
It seems that this breakage was introduced in tensorflow/models@cbb6247 which made the slim code depend on the master branch of TensorFlow instead of the release version

@sguada : Is models/research/slim meant to depend on building TensorFlow from the HEAD of master branch? Or should the change mentioned above be rolled back to keep it compatible with the least official release (1.3.0)
body_text:
It seems that this breakage was introduced in tensorflow/models@cbb6247 which made the slim code depend on the master branch of TensorFlow instead of the release version
@sguada : Is models/research/slim meant to depend on building TensorFlow from the HEAD of master branch? Or should the change mentioned above be rolled back to keep it compatible with the least official release (1.3.0)
body:
It seems that this breakage was introduced in https://github.com/tensorflow/models/commit/cbb624791068590026f50f01d370d9328fe8ebf2 which made the `slim` code depend on the master branch of TensorFlow instead of the release version

@sguada : Is `models/research/slim` meant to depend on building TensorFlow from the HEAD of master branch? Or should the change mentioned above be rolled back to keep it compatible with the least official release (1.3.0)
